scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The New York Album viewbook was printed circa 1890 and consists of 22 pages of black-and-white non-photographic prints of drawings depicting historic buildings, structures, and monuments located throughout New York City. The viewbook contains only a few scenes of Brooklyn, though images of the Brooklyn Bridge and the entrances to the Brooklyn Bridge are well-represented in the viewbook. The viewbook has its original hardcover and its pages measure 6.75 x 7.5. The binding is broken and all of the pages are now loose. Digital versions of the images from the viewbook pertaining to Brooklyn are available via the image database located in the library. It is not known who created or printed the viewbook.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Brooklyn Historical Society also holds other viewbooks relating to New York City and Brooklyn, though the bulk of them depict images of Brooklyn. Please consult library staff for more information.
